Glasgow Ky Apl 20 1865
To his Excelency
Thos E Bramlette
Gov of Ky

Dr Sir Our Country is literally filled with Guerillas, as has been the Case for a Considerable Time an organised State or -- National Force Mounted Armed and Equiped is Necessary more especially here to rid the Country of those unprinclipled thieves & cutthroats. And I propose, Gov, to Raise in this Country a Company Composed of the best Material for the purpose of Riding the country of those prowling thieves. And to Assist the Civil as well as the Military in the discharge of all of their Duties legally

I have directed this to your notice Gov particularly because you know me personally, but I feel Confident that if you will vest in me that authority that I will Raise a Company that will Reflect no discredit to the State I am Gov your most obt Servt --

Glasgow Ky
April 20. 1865
Martin Meredith
to
Gov. Bramlette
Says his Country is literally filled wih Guerillas & Cut-throats says he will raise a Company of good men if you will give him authority that shall be no discredit to the State

Hd Qrs Ky Volunteers
Adjt Generals Office
April 22d 1865
Respectfully referred to Maj W H Hays Inspt Genl Ky.

D. W. Lindsey
Adj Genl Ky

L B. No 12. P. 22
Recd A G. O. April 22. 1865

Reciev. Ins Gen Off. April, 24/64.
